lines.text:
[after his parachute is turned into an anvil and he crashes to the ground, he is beating on the anvil with a hammer and babbling a passage from The Village Smithy by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow]
"Under a spreading chestnut-tree, The village smithy stands; The smith, a mighta-ty man is he, With strong and sinewy..."
[while he is doing this, the anvil is erased and is replaced with an explosive shell pointing straight up. After a few more hits, the bomb explodes]
...H-Hands...
[shakes himself off]
All right. Enough is enough. This is the final, the - the very, very last straw! Who's responsible for this? This... I demand that you show yourself! Who are you? Huh?
[as he's venting, a doorway with an open door is drawn around him, then the door is pushed closed by the eraser]
All right, let's get this picture started.
[iris out to The End title card]

[pushing card aside]
NO! NO!

[on an island in the distance]
Hey, come here! Come here! Give me a close-up. A close-up!
[film frame contracts around Daffy]
This is a close-up?

[screaming]
A close-up, you jerk! A close-up!
[camera zooms up to an extreme close-up of Daffy's bloodshot eyes]
Thanks for the sour persimmons, cousin.

[looking at poorly-drawn background]
That's dandy! Ho-ho, that's rich, I'll say!
[yells]
Now how about some color, stupid?
[artist draws Daffy in wild, polka-dot colors]
Hey!
[in a rage]
Mmmm... Not me, you slop artist!
[projector sticks between frames]
Now what?
What are you doing down there?
Down here? What are you doing up there?
[pointing upward, sarcastically]
*Down* here.

I'll tell you what. You go your way, and I'll go mine. Live and let live. Right? Right. Ladies and gentlemen, there will be no further delays, so I shall attempt to entertain you in my own iniminiminitable fashion.
[last lines]
[the unseen tormentor is revealed as Bugs Bunny]
Ain't I a stinker?

[artist has re-drawn him as a weird flower-like creature, with a three-sided flag of a screw & a ball, titling Daffy as a SCREWBALL]
That's strange. All of a sudden I don't quite feel like myself. Oh, I feel all right, and yet I... I uh...
[sees his figure in a mirror]
EEEEEK! YOU KNOW BETTER THAN THAT!

[after the island paradise disappears]
Buster, it may come as a complete surprise to you to find that this is an animated cartoon, and that in animated cartoons they have scenery, and in all the years I've...
[as he's venting, he is slowly being erased from feet up and is silenced when his face is erased]
All right wise guy, where am I?

[to a duplicate Daffy Duck]
Listen, bud, if you wasn't me, I'd smack you right in the puss.
Don't let that bother you, Jack.
Okay, buddy, you asked for it.

[sings]
Daffy Duck he had a farm, E... I... E... I... O.
[scenery changes]
And on this farm he had an *igloo*, ee... ayyy... ee... ayyy... dohhh?

[is redrawn as a sailor]
Hmm. Sea picture, eh? I always wanted to do a sea epic. Now, Mr. Rembrandt, if you'll kindly oblige with a little appropriate scenery.
[the animator paints a seascape, but no boat for Daffy to stand on]

[singing]
Over the sea, let's go, men. We're shovin' right off, we're shovin' right off... again?
[falls into the sea]
What a way to run a railroad.
Would it be too much to ask if we could make up our minds, hmmmm?
[first lines]
Stand back, musketeers, they shall sample my blade! Touché!
[suddenly realizes that there is absolutely nothing behind him]
Musketeers? Hm? En garde, eh? My blade? Hey, psst. Whoever's in charge here! The scenery! Where's the scenery?

[in a rage]
... And I've never be so humiliated in all my life!
